name: Parker Palm Springs

reviews.title: Leave your attitude at the door and chill at the Parker!
reviews.text: I've now stayed at the Parker 4 times - traveling on business- and have had each stay better the the one before. The staff was friendly and helpfule everytime I needed something. I enjoy the fact it is not a MEGA-Hotel or, a tourist trap in the Downtown area. I love the rooms, grounds and restaurants. Having traveled all over the world, it's refreshing not to stay in a "typical" hotel. This is a unique property and if you don't have an open mind - then stay elsewhere!

reviews.title: Totally bad place to stay!!!
reviews.text: The hotel looks great from the outside. The gardens and the inside is nice. However, the staff especially the front office staff is just terrible. I checked in at the evening hours and had to deal with a very unprofessional group of staff members. The front office supervisor was rude and did not want to solve our problem. We were there to check in but had to wait and then when we got to our room, it had dirty ugly stains on the carpet. She would not help us at all. The effect of the place is beautiful but the prices and the service was the worst i have ever experienced. It seems for the high rates and prices, they could get good experienced and nice staff.. guess not.. overall, the parker is not what it claims to be.. It would be better to stay at the Holiday Inn or The Viceroy.....or anywhere else in Palm Springs..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2006
reviews.text: I happened to stay at the Parker by pure accident. I was in Palm Springs, supposedly staying with friends. When that went awry, I found myself without a place to stay and the Parker was nearby. It was 10 at night, I was distraught, and having read the mixed reviews, I was a little hesitant, but the reception offered me a choice of three rooms,all well below the rack rate. I settled for one with a patio and a hammock normally just over 400 a night, for 280. The lobby and public areas were so fantastic that I could not wait to examine them in detail. I was lead to my room (218) way across the other side of the property,( I believe several acres),which seemed at night like an intriguingly landscaped maze of meandering paths, illuminated yet mysterious. My room had a 4 poster bed, with high thread count sheets, duvet and feather pillows. Furniture was a combination of sixties, modern and Hollywood Regency, and included cool touches like old books like titles like Valley of the Dolls and a bathroom well stocked with mini toiletries from Molton Brown, Hermes, Erno Lazlo etc.
reviews.title: Le Parker, je t'adore

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2006
reviews.text: The following morning I tried Norma's cafe for breakfast. The fresh muesli came wrapped in sliced mango and my tea, strong as I had requested, was made in a french press. French songsfrom the 60's permeated the air, which just added to the general feeling of nostalgia for a bygone era and a certain je ne sais quoi. I cannot wait to return
reviews.title: Don't Believe the Cretans!
Great welcome, terrible chef concierge, bad management.
reviews.text: In reading some of the reviews here I wonder if they stayed at the same hotel that I did!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled with friends
reviews.text: My friend and I went to The Parker for a quick girls week away, we both were stressed and this was our first stop (for 2 nights). The weather was HOT so you hung by the pool (s) in the morning. the pools were very relaxing. We had massages and those were great, but, they were re-doing the mens area of the spa and the smell of the apoxy they were using made the womans area a lethal smelling area (not so relaxing).
reviews.title: Way above my expectations

likes.liked: — The low key but beautiful resort
likes.disliked: — Some times a bit too 70's looking (Johnathan Adler look)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had coffee every morning and we were upgraded to a suite - nice..the staff was very friendly but not obtrusive. the whole no checking in thing was great.
reviews.title: Perfect Anniversary Weekend at the Parker

likes.liked: — The personal attention we received from John Federbusch -- room upgrade, golf lessons, chocolate covered strawberries, coffee with wakeup call.
likes.disliked: — The bathroom could have been updated and tub didn't drain very well -- also would have appreciated an ice machine or ice in the room.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006
reviews.text: The only thing that I would have to say is that there were some bugs on floor in our room in the mornings but I am assuming that it is pretty hard to keep the bugs out considering it is a desert area. So, watch your feet!
reviews.title: Loved the Parker
They overcharged me by double, their mistake, and still not re-imbursed!
reviews.text: IT was a low key resort for those who just want to relax..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled on business
reviews.text: My husband and I work for a huge law firm in Los Angeles and we travel regularly to 5-star properties for business and vacations. Our expectations are very high and the Parker exceeded our hopes.
reviews.title: Oddball, quirky hotel but significantly overhyped

likes.liked: — Marginally low rates off season; reasonable location within Palm Springs
likes.disliked: — Tries way too hard to be hip and cool and only succeeds in being pretentious

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: It took us about 2 days to find our way around this amazingly beautiful property, but with every wrong turn we discovered more beauty. The hotel lobby is extremly eclectic, with furnishings depicting the 50's & 60's. Our room, however, was very modern & beautiful. That's not to say that the lobby wasn't beautiful, just furnished differently than our room. Our room was quite large & comfortable. We had a room with a patio & hammock. It was worth the extra cost. The pool side rooms, although convenient, were not private. Our room was quiet & so private when being on the patio & we were just a few short steps from the pool. Now my negatives: We had our 14 year old granddaughter with us & no one informed us at check in that she would not be allowed in the indoor pool/spa area. It was embarrassing for her when she was asked to leave. Had we known in advance she would not have been there. We went to the store & bought pool noodles & when we tried to use them were told no pool toys allowed. Again, check in should have informed us. The large pool is also adults only & we were not informed at check in. We were promised a roll-a-way at 4 PM & it never came. Then they said 7 PM & when we returned to our room at midnight it still had not arrived! It came after my call to them. For the price we paid that was unacceptable! But....would we go back...definately!
reviews.title: Beautiful Scenery

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I loved the grounds of the hotel: the adult pool, the maze-like walking paths, hammocks, fire pit, lounge areas. And as the mother of a toddler it was nice to get away to a resort with VERY few children in sight. And the ones that were there were very well behaved. No wining or crying or running around. It was a great "adult" escape.
reviews.title: Great resort for an adult escape

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The valet guys were fantastic! Greeted us with a friendly welcome, always retrieved our car very quickly, opened doors, carried our luggage from lobby and packed into trunk upon departure. Always smiling and very helpful.
reviews.title: Loved it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011
reviews.text: I was also super impressed that someone found our camera and the Parker is shipping it to us. I've left behind a handful of favorite items in various hotels over the years to never see them again. I was absolutely delighted to learn that our camera had been recovered!
reviews.title: Serenity and pefection!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only thing I was unimpressed with was the hotel room. We stayed in 50 South - a standard room right upstairs from the lobby - and it was below expectations for a resort of this caliber. I'm a window gal that loves natural light and the windows were frosted so we couldn't see out (probably to hide a bad view) but it made me feel claustrophobic. The room itself could have used more light overall especially in the closet. When it was dark I could hardly find anything in my suitcase. Had we not been running so late for the wedding we were attending I would have requested another room. Or if this had been a weekend away as a couple we would have switched rooms the next day. But it was wedding weekend full of friends and activities so we didn't spend much time in the room. I was also surprised that there was not an ipod docking station - not even an alarm clock - and the TV had not been updated to a flat screen. But the mid-century modern decor was fun and kitschy (in a good way) and enjoyable as something different.
reviews.title: Worst Hotel Experience Ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Young and hip best describes this place. We loved our stay even though things started out a bit rough. We made reservations a few months in advance requesting a room with 2 beds to accomodate four girls. As luck would have it their computer system was down the day we arrived. The staff at the front desk informed us that they only had a room with a king bed available. Obviously a king bed was unacceptable so after a bit of explaining the hotel staff upgraded our room to a one bedroom villa with a pullout couch. The service was outstanding during the remainder of our stay and the grounds were gorgeous. The spa services were excellent and the room was clean and comfortable. Breakfast at Norma's was to die for! All of us enjoyed ourselves so much we're already planning another trip to the Parker. Highly recommend.
reviews.title: Luxury with Style

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2006
reviews.text: This is definitely a fun place to stay. It's very chic and the pools are very nice. The only big problem is the service. The front desk person was incredibly rude and not too bright. Trust me I'm not the kind of person who says this about every waiter, etc. I was very respectful of them but I was treated like I was trying to sell them something. These people where actually just plain rude. It's too bad really. It's sort of cliche. A hip hotel with super hip unfriendly staff that think they are too cool for school. Next time I'll stay at the Viceroy. We went there for dinner and they were so nice!
reviews.title: Like the Space but the Service Was Horrib.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006
reviews.text: I just loved the Parker Palm Springs. Our room felt like home and was so relaxing. I will definitely be staying there everytime I go to Palm Springs. Absolutely wonderful!
reviews.title: Loved The Parker!!!!
A Relaxing Visit at a True Luxury Resort
reviews.text: Just returned from a two-night getaway to the Parker Palm Springs (stayed from July 2-4). It was my first visit at the hotel and it truly lived up to all the hype. Absolutely beautiful and incredibly peaceful grounds, wonderfully chic decor, fabulous and attentive service, very comfortable rooms and remarkably delicious food. Despite the blistering 105+ degree heat, my boyfriend and I had a very relaxing stay and truly felt like we were "getting away". We took advantage of the wonderful PSYC spa and loved the facilities and services. Would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a truly luxurious resort in Palm Springs!

reviews.title: fantastic place, ignore the doubters
reviews.text: stayed at the Parker over 4 days last week in 118 degrees heatwave and found the hotel and staff absolutely top class. Was on a trip that invloved stays at the Soho Grand in New York, Viceroy in LA and the Parker, and the Parker stood out by miles.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at the Parker Palm Springs about 3 years ago on a work trip and have been dying to go back ever since. This was the perfect place to go and unwind. From the beautiful scenery, the cool vintage vibe and the down to earth and professional staff, the Parker Palm Springs will always be my favorite place to stay. I had the opportunity to go to a free yoga class taught by a wonderful yogi and I had one of the best massages I've ever had at their Spa. This resort isn't like others in Vegas or LA where the staff is snooty and just looking for a tip. I did spend a pretty penny this weekend and I'm happy to say it was worth every cent. The crowd that is attracted to this place is very chill, they bring their pups and lay by the pool. I highly highly recommend the Parker. This place will always be my gift to myself when I want a great and relaxing weekend.
reviews.title: My favorite hotel of all time!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: This hotel is very relaxing, with great grounds, and an amazing spa.
reviews.title: Great hotel, HORRIBLE SERVICE AND STAFF

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One BIG problem is the staff. My family has been staying here for years (even before it was called the Parker). Each time we go there, we walk out relaxed and extremely disappointed with the service.
reviews.title: Amazing resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: The hotel definitely will not provide you with a 5 star hotel type of service. So do not expect that. The problem is that they don't even provide a 4 star hotel service. I completely agree with some of the comments below as to how the hotel always claims to be fully booked or busy yet IT IS NOT! This line is just part of the policy to prevent any kind of accommodation.
reviews.title: Love the Parker - best hotel in PSP

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011
reviews.text: The staff is always changing and always in training. Many of them are young kids you want to get into the hotel business and have no clue how to treat guests. I really cant blame them since the training the Parker gives them is obviously very poor.
reviews.title: Fun, Funky, and Friendly!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: What a perfect place to get away from the city! The entire atmosphere is peaceful. The grounds are a maze of private pathways, the staff is super friendly and accommodating. Highly recommend happy hour in the hotel lobby bar!
reviews.title: Retro, Hip, Relaxing, and weekend heaven!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Such a wonderful place! My only gripe is the Lemonade Stand, put those girls/ladies in sleeveless yellow tops and/or tank tops, it's way to hot for "polo" shirts in the summer! Also, they need a professional "janitorial" clean of the Lemonade Stand bar area, bad smells! I saw the girls hosing down the matts/spraying with bleach, but unfortunately the smell wouldn't go away... As far as everything else, one doesn't need to leave the hotel grounds, the Parker has everything, great restaurnats, grounds, pools, spa, atmosphere, rooms, art, entertainment, people/guests (met a lot of nice people!), hammocks, the robes/towels in the spa, and GREAT SERVICE! thank you~ Don't leave w/ out booking a spa apt. LOVED everything about it, thanks Jessie & Staff & Jim!
reviews.title: Love the Sunshine, Inside & Out!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You have to experience the spa, no doubt! The rooms are lovely and the feeling from the front door to all the Parker has to offer is indulgent relaxed and a sweet escape.
reviews.title: My Bday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was the BEST weekend getaway my husband and I have had! We are looking forward to returning next month. Mr. Parker is a must!!!
reviews.title: PERFECTION!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Beautiful grounds, fantastic customer service -- perfect stay!
reviews.title: AMAZING all around!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: I've loved this place since I first found it in 2005. First class establishment all the way. I'll be back as much as possible.
reviews.title: Downtime was never better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: What a magical property! This place transcends all you've known before in regard to hotels. It really is an experience from the moment you arrive. Behind every corner is something unusual and unexpected. I can't wait to stay again!!!
reviews.title: My new favorite hotel!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I love the Parker. It is truly one of my favorite places to be. The grounds are amazing and everything feels private, classy but you can still do whatever you want. I was there last weekend to celebrate my bf's birthday. This is my third stay at the Parker We got a room with our own hammock and it was amazing. The decor and grounds makes this resort first class and so individualized. If you want to be social you can be or if you do not want to talk to anyone there is plenty of space to do so. The spa is amazing and so is the indoor pool.
reviews.title: First Class

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If I had to be critical about something it would be that I wished there were more menu options at the pool grill and more umbrellas around the pool. It was really hot in august!
reviews.title: Retro splendour

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: As always we met amazing guests at the pool and both my bf and I commented that it feels like you are staying at your rich aunt's house and she is throwing the best house party every with such interesting guests! The only difference is that the drinks are expensive!
reviews.title: Upscale and an amazingly friendly attentive staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was my second stay at the Parker. Last time was in April. A lot more young kids were there this time. We also had poor service at Norma's for Sunday brunch. I still loved almost everything else. The only thing I really didn't like though was the lounge chairs by the pool are metal and the cushions aren't thick enough, leaving it kind of uncomfortable, especially if you plan to make the pool your destination. Great celeb spotting. Saw big stars on both trips.
reviews.title: Always great but...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Parker several years ago and can't wait to go back. The grounds, architecture and rooms were all very beautiful. We were only able to stay 1 night at the time but had a great time and great food. We will be visiting again soon.
reviews.title: Loved everything about it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have been a loyal guest of the Parker since it opened. I had always appreciated the low key, cool vibe where I could relax and get a away from the noise of a busy life. Mid week after a holiday weekend should have been a quiet and peaceful stay. This was quite the opposite. There were so many kids running around both pools, I couldn't even hear myself think. They used to play great song playlists at the pool. Not any more. If I wanted Kiddieville, I could have stayed at the Marriott. This is not my Parker! There are 2 full size pools at the hotel. The least they could do is designate one pool for adults and one for pee sharks. Disappointed...........
reviews.title: Screaming babies in kiddieville. The Parker sold out!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Love the hotel, Love Mister Parkers, Love the staff and the rooms, Hate the pool its so quite you can listen to everyones conversation .Please turn your music back on....
reviews.title: turn the music up at the pool- there is none===== sleepy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just got back from an amazing stay at the Parker in Palm Springs. Totally chic. I must admit that we were a little hesitant to stay here based on the reviews here. The grounds were my favorite thing about this hotel. The pool was a great people watching place. We thought that the resort fee was well worth the price. $30.00 a day included valet parking and full use of the spa amenities. Which included daily yoga classes, sauna, steam room work out gym and fresh fruit. The yoga instructor that we had was awesome! The rooms were nice but would have to agree with others on the flat screens. Breakfast was so amazing, I want to go back just for that. The staff was extremely helpful and nice from beginning to end. Can't wait to make it back there.
reviews.title: Loved It!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had an excellent time at the Parker and can't wait to go back again, which I definitely plan to do soon. I don't get all of the bad reviews. I have to admit that I was hesitant when booking due to the bad reviews, but I decided to give it a try based on a friend's recommendation. The hotel and the service exceeded my expecations (and I travel quite often and tend to only stay at top notch hotels).
reviews.title: Great Stay. Great Service. Will Be Back.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The decor of the hotel was eccentric and original. It's not ultra luxurious, but I liked that it wasn't stuffy. The rooms were clean and the beds were comfortable as well. I stayed in a standard room and it was great, though I would definitely like to check out their deluxe rooms and villas the next time around. The air conditioning in the room didn't seem like it was working as well as I thought it could, but it didn't ruin my stay. Also, there were a few kids at the pool that were a little noisy, but a few drinks seemed to help me tune them out.
reviews.title: It's OK.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food at the hotel was excellent as well. I had breakfast, dinner and cocktails there and all were up to par. The service was also fantastic, from the front desk, to the waiters, bartenders and the valet. The concierge even called before my visit and asked if he could be of service, and then after my visit I received a form survey about my stay via email. I filled out the survey not expecting a response from the hotel and was pleasantly surprised to see that they personally responded to my comments in the survey about the air conditioning. I think this is indicative of great service.
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay but Expensive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel to my friends and family. I will be back again soon!
reviews.title: DO NOT STAY HERE IF YOU APPRECIATE HIGH QUALITY CUSTOMER SERVICE AND RELAXATION

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Not great, but OK.
reviews.title: Overpriced Motel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I traveled here with a friend to get away for the weekend. This is a very trendy hotel, so if you are used to traditional, this is not for you. The hallways to get to your room were really creepy - like something out of the Shining. The rooms were fun and interesting. The history of the hotel is also pretty interesting. Its fun when you want to just get away and experience something different. The concierge was able to make a great dinner recommendation and we had a fabulous time, even though it was so hot outside (which is to be expected in the desert in august) !
reviews.title: Unique Experience
Not at all impressed if you are over 30 yrs old!
reviews.text: It was my husbands 60th birthday and we had a hard time celebrating. We are GOLD members and on check in we were told there were no upgrades or late check out, rudely so.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We couldn't find our room, since we got no directions and it was at night. Our room had no bathtub so we changed rooms and were downscaled to a room with a view of trash cans and a parking lot. These rooms still have TUBE televisions! What?? We have stayed at Starwood properties around the world. Hands down this was the worst experience. It was the weekend of the Music Festival...so the hotel was jammed with the "it" people. We even got our car rammed by a so called "celebrity." Our daughters arranged for a cake and champagne to be sent to our room for my husbands birthday, it never made it! 24,000 points later....not happy. However, 1 good thing...the food at Normas!
reviews.title: We had THE BEST time and loved everything!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived after midnight having driven in from LA. We were lost and the desk clerk was really not much help, such as calling the giant green hedge that surrounds the hotel a big green wall, we thought it was funny later. Their check in process could have been better. The bellman wandered off with our bags but forgot us, so we had this strange little "Lord of the Rings" looking map and we stumbled through all the little trails trying to find our room. It was totally pitch black and we couldn't see the map. It is very romantic once you know the pathways, but on check-in it was annoying. The first thing we thought when we walked in was "Oh my God, where are we? Liberace's house?" Once you get over the shock of how really retro-1970's it is, you actually appreciate how well they did make it appear 1970's and you start to have fun with it! We had this HUGE black and white photo of Carol Channing with these giant glasses on in our room. Our friends had all these retro black and white photos in their room too, it just added to the unusual theme and made us all laugh and start to relax. The rooms were very clean, but you don't want to hang out in them, the grounds are where you want to be. The pool was perfect and relaxing. A waiter comes by about every 15 minutes to check if you want food or drinks, they are very professional and keep in tone with a relaxed, but efficient vacation mode. You really felt pampered with this staff overall (except the front desk). The spa was so relaxing and clean, we spent about 5 hours in there just laughing and talking and relaxing. The restaurant on site was wonderful for breakfast and lunch. For breakfast the menu was very creative and different (about $125 for four) and worth the money. Some places you go the food is expensive and mediocre, but this chef and his team were quite good. The servers were excellent, and even accomodated us for lunch when they were near closing time for them, and they didn't make us feel rushed-very cool people. The grounds are immaculate and welcoming to relax in. They have lawn games, hammocks, private seating areas, all very inviting and well-thought-out; and again, with the wait staff checking on you in these areas to see if you need anything. We were SO relaxed and pampered we really didn't want to leave! We look forward to going again, and we highly recommend this hotel if you want to truly "get away from it all". I would not suggest it as a place for children though, it is more of a couples/adults/friends type of environment.
reviews.title: Disappointing who wouldn't if you get my room?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I am not impressed. I am using my points. I have to pay $30 per day for resort fee. They gave me the worst room. I hope you don't get it. I am a platinum member. no upgrade because the hotel is sold out. no free water in the room. only thing I got free is the free wireless in the room. maybe it is free for all.
reviews.title: Less Than Expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: I visited the Parker with my husband and teenage daughter. The style is hip and fun -- the lobby and lounge area looks like a 60's swinging bachelor pad. The rooms are large. The grounds are gorgeous. The saline pools are great - no chlorine and nicely cooled (unlike many other hotels with pools as warm as bathwater in the summer). The loungers were very comfortable. The food is overpriced, but very good. Morning wake-up call with coffee was a wonderful way to start the morning. The spa is fabulous -- but just as expensive as you would expect. Summer rates at $89 per night really make it worth the stay. The only reason I didn't rate the hotel a 5 is because the service is hit and miss.
reviews.title: Fun place to stay, great pools, fabulous spa
Wow!
reviews.text: My other favorite hotel in the area -- La Quinta -- is horrible in the summer because all the pools are hot. This is a better choice for a summer vacation.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: WOW!
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were staying in a very expensive hotel in LA and June gloom had descended in August so we decided to check out of LA and were advised by friends in that the place to go for guaranteed sunshine was Palm Springs.
reviews.title: Good stay - could be much better ....

likes.disliked: — lack of pool chairs and small size of pools

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled solo
reviews.text: This can be very very hot in the summer so its very off season. The Americans just don't wast to go there. So... this fantastic hotel, which can cost $600 a night in season was £89.99 a night in August . The place is a 5 star de-luxe with great rooms, staff who know you by name ( well there werent many of us there) two outdoor pools ( cooled so they remain refreshing), a spa to die for with separate male and female indoor pools sauna and steam. The internet rate doesn't include the $30 a day resort charge but this is a bargain and if you are drivng to Vegas or just wasnt a few days r and r and dont mind having the pool to yourself, this cant be beaten. With Ossie Osborne and Brad Pitt as guests ( in season of course) you can see that these prices are just keep the place running off season. The area has a few shopping malls, a water park, the usual array of restaurants, but the star is the place itself. We went there at the end of our 10 days moving round and 4 nights here rounded the holiday well. And its only about 2.5hours from LA with a great drive if you like that scenery. Careful though, the week we were there it was 103-106F the week before it was 115. Lots of shade by the pool but best to shopping or out for lunch 12-4.
reviews.title: Still one of my favourites, even though mixed experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I feel like this is one hotel that is trying to cater to my demographic. The design of the rooms, lobby and restaurant is a great balance of modern and kitsch. The service was good, the food was good, the grounds are really cool and the pool was really relaxing while we were there during the week. The hotel fails in a few ways, however. I was really not impressed with the resort fee, it should have been included in the nightly cost. There is also no excuse for any hotel not to have coffee makers in the rooms (and then only a 6 dollar coffee option). The televisions definitely need to be updated. There are just some things that people expect from a hotel that this place doesn't have. Maybe they think that coffee makers would attract the wrong clientele... I say this half joking because that kind of attitude floats around and I'm not sure why. Otherwise this place is great, it just needs some minor changes and polishing. Then maybe it will earn the reputation it's going for.
reviews.title: Great concept

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Firstly, I have to say anyone that gives this place a negative review should consider checking in to the Hilton or Holiday Inn because they obviously need some chain atmosphere to make there trip special. This is not the place for those kinds of people. As a Starwood Platinum member I have been to Westins all over North America and most of that was just this summer. The Parker is one of the most unique and amazing properties Starwood has. Everything has been incredible. The standard room (I was offered a suite but took standard because the three children don't care for rollaway beds) is very spacious. Upon check-in one of the hotel manager's learned all of our names and on various visits to whatever we were doing during the day called us by name and checked on how our stay was going. I have rarely, if ever, experienced such a personable crew of associates. They manage is stay bright and cheery even when they have difficult, demanding guests (there were many of those types here this weekend). If coming be sure to hangout at The Lemonade Stand. It has amazing concoctions and fantastic associates. I love them! They treated my children like a regular guests and offered them lemonade anytime they simply walked by. Also, if you want a place where you can let your children wonder a bit without ever having to worry then this is it! Security guards are quietly everywhere. I am not sure if it is because they get the famous and wealthy or if it is just to make sure things go off without a hitch, but either way it was a wonderful feeling. Additionally they keep rowdy guests in line. While we were here we witnessed a wedding and if you need a place for that then you should consider The Parker. There are only a few, minor things I would change. Firstly, I do think it would be nice to upgrade the television to a flat panel and to add a coffee maker to the rooms. Additionally I would like to see a king suite with a pull-out bed. That's probably about it. These are just personal preference items and with that said I know a resort can't be everything to everyone so if they never change these things I don't care! I am on the phone to my Platinum Concierge associate tomorrow booking my next week. I can't wait to come back and wonder the grounds, relax, and get away from it all. Hail to The Parker staff for creating an amazing environment for their guests and for us. I, and Kate, Trent, and Trevor thank you and admire your skills!
reviews.title: AMAZING ECCENTRIC PLACE TO STAY! WHAT A STAFF! WHAT A PLACE!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Beautiful grounds gone bad - Do not stay here! I woke up with bed bug bites, but thought it might have just been a spider or mosquitos until I got home and the nasty welts convinced me to head to the doc. Left multiple v/m for Thomas the GM and he took a couple weeks to get back to me. He had Vanessa call who acted liked she really cared, said this was a big deal, wanted to get more info and she promised to get back. Well, she never did. Common theme here with these postings - spiders in the room, management doesn't care, cold shoulders, etc. Not to mention my car was left out front near the valet with the window down and keys in the ignition ALL day. I came down, loeaded the kids and drove off and nobody had any idea! Brutal.
reviews.title: Bed Bugs

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pros: Grounds are pretty, lobby is beautifully designed, rooms are spacious, fast room service, comfy beds, cool pool, yummy but expensive drinks...
reviews.title: Other reviews say it all...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Cons: Indifferent attitude by some staff, old tv's in rooms, no video-on-demand,furniture seen better days- dirty, etc, no view from room- frosted windows, couldn't get a hold of the front desk, shower had flimsy curtain that sticks to you while showering.
reviews.title: Our Favorite Escape!!!

description: Imagine spending a weekend at your great aunt's home, an extremely elegant lady of indeterminate age. Her home, the Parker Palm Springs, is full of the kind of patina achieved by always purchasing the best, knowing that living well ages all things with a particular beauty. What is Happy Luxe? Happy Luxe is luxury without formality, beauty without pretension, elegance with comfort.
